page.title: 17DARRINGTON QUARRIES
page.content: Darrington Quarries have been working at the Cridling Stubbs site since 1942.They have 7 other quarries which are part of the same group.10 people are employed extracting the stone at the Cridling Stubbs quarry. Limestone is taken in different grades and sizes,the most common being 1\inch diameter or smaller.{1000 tons of {limestone leave the quarry each day. This is from a 9 hour working day.The quarry is open 5\ days a week. Main uses of the stone are for concrete products,ready mixed concrete,motorway bases and drainage media.Regular local buyers are Plasmor,Readimix and Tilcon. As the lorries leave the quarry they are weighed and washed.Even so the roads leading to the quarry are often white with limestone dust.
